Name: The omniscience-immutability argument (map)
Text: God knows all, and believes truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. He also is completely unchangable. However there are some facts, like “It is now 15:31” that go out of date. These so-called A-propositions (really? What does the A stand for?). It is thus impossible for an unchangable being (one who's knowledge does not change) to know one of these A-propositions as to know such a thing would require the change of knowledge. Therefore: an immutable God cannot be omniscient.

Name: Conceptually possible?
Text: This is a premise (and an extremely bold claim at that), and therefore needs an explaination.
